item.title: Code your robot
item.description: We are currently developing a native WebBT LE terminal for our site In the meantime, you can use the one developed by the Circuit Python community Circuit Python USB/Bluetooth Web Terminal

item.title: Code your robot
item.description: Hook up your USB cable, then click connect Choose the connection with ACM in the name Â Â (Click below for Instructions:) ðŸ—€ The codekitty module To use (import): from codekitty import * ðŸ—€ Moving go(x) drive forward for x seconds back(x) drive backward for x seconds left(x) turn left for x seconds right(x) turn right for x seconds ðŸ—€ Sounds meow() Have your kitty robot say “meow”

item.title: Contact
item.description: Connect to Code Kitty Please fill out the contact form and connect with us. We’d love to hear from you!

item.title: Workshops
item.description: The Code Kitty Workshop Model Our workshops have helped over 300 students succeed at coding, robotics, and engineering. All of our donations go back into providing our robot kits and instructional materials as cheaply as possible, and we rely on grants to cover our operational costs. Our robots are printed from biodegradable PLA plastic (made from corn starch!), on 3D printers powered with solar power. Green is the new black.
